meanings.definition: Reflecting light or radiation back in the direction from which it came.
meanings.sent1: The retroreflective sign made the road visible at night.
meanings.sent2: The retroreflective tape on the bike increased visibility in the dark.
meanings.sent3: The retroreflective jacket made the cyclist look like a shining star.
meanings.sent4: Her retroreflective smile brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The retroreflective paint on the walls created a magical glow.

meanings.definition: A material or surface that reflects light or radiation back towards its source.
meanings.sent1: The retroreflective was used on the safety vests for construction workers.
meanings.sent2: The road signs were made of retroreflective material for better visibility.
meanings.sent3: The retroreflective acted like a mirror, bouncing light back to the source.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like retroreflective surfaces, always reflecting emotions.
meanings.sent5: The retroreflective surface of the moon made it shine in the night sky.
